title: Kyoto â†’ Onomichi - Kurashiki
content:
After spending a few nights in Kyoto, I was heading off towards Onomichi where I would be attempting the decent bike ride along the Shimanami Kaido tomorrow!

Along the way, I wanted to stop in Kurashiki to see the historic district, complete with canal and weeping trees!

A short walk from the station, this area had a nice variety of old style buildings, as well as some European style buildings mixed in. It made for a unique feel to the area, but the main attraction was the canal area, lined with weeping trees and small shops in traditional style buildings. While the canal area was a bit smaller than I had expected, and only a couple of the trees had started to show leaves, it was still a nice place to see. I can imagine how nice it would be to grab a meal or drink in one of the small shops, and enjoy the atmosphere during spring with the trees full of colour!

After another train ride I was in Onomichi. On the walk to the hotel I passed a restaurant that looked good for dinner, and the bike rental place, so I would be ready for getting into things quickly tomorrow morning!

The rest of the day was spent relaxing before having a bit of an earlier night in the hopes that I would be well rested for the long day ahead!
